Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate”
Reviews.Author: BostonToronto
Reviews.Content: Although everything else seemed to be okay with this motel, which does have an elevator and breakfast to its credit, I have to agree with the other visitor who had bug bites. My inlaws saw one and knew what it was right away. They complained and were offered a different room and when I asked what would happen to the other room they told me it would be closed until pest control came. They are definitely aware of the problem. They did not offer a refund because it was booked through an online booking site, but they said they would grant it if they were contacted by Expedia. Would rate it a 3 if it wasn't for this problem.

Reviews.Title: “beware of your possessions”
Reviews.Author: Cheryll D
Reviews.Content: After realizing i had left my camera behind in the room, i called only to be told it wasn't in the lost and found... This told me that the staff had not turned it in. So much for the administration hiring reputable staff. I also was not impressed with the cleanliness or lack of the hotel. The elevator reaked of smoke. The walls in the room and bathroom had holes ... under the bed hadn't seen a vacuum in a long time... the dust bunnies were big enough to even scare off the easter bunny.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel, Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: stokelToronto
Reviews.Content: When Kingston Road was the only eastern entrance to Toronto, there was a plethora of good inexpensive hotels and motels along the strip east of where Danforth Avenue and Kingston Road meet. The Lakeview Inn is the closest to the junction and perhaps the newest on the strip. The inn is clean and modern. Our room, 129 was on the main floor and quite austere. It had two queen beds, a washroom, and an old fashioned TV (remember picture tubes?). There was a small table and two chairs and a small hutch for clothing that also held the TV. The coffee maker only came with one package of coffee but the bathroom was nicely equipped with lots of towels, shampoo, conditioner and hand soap. The beds were moderately firm and the pillows soft and inviting. I can't imagine who would find this hotel location convenient. The hotel is located in the former city of Scarborough, quite some distance from the attractions of downtown. We were staying one night as our nearby house was under renovation. People driving into Toronto from the east cannot access the hotel directly as there is a boulevard and no left turn into the parking lot. http://maps.google.ca/maps?q=toronto+lakeside+days+inn&hl=en&ll=43.702096,-79.253813&spn=0.741628,1.234589&sll=43.615085,-79.382576&sspn=0.04791,0.077162&vpsrc=6&hq=lakeside+days+inn&hnear=Toronto,+Toronto+Division,+Ontario&t=h&fll=43.683764,-79.222412&fspn=0.741849,1.234589&z=10&layer=c&cbll=43.702096,-79.253813&panoid=NDtx-Js70g-P__BLoCVeLw&cbp=12,192.52,,0,16.43 There is a bus stop 60 metres east of the hotel. The only bus that will take you directly to the subway doesn't stop at that stop during rush hours. The 12 km ride to northeast Scarborough took 40 minutes with one transfer. I would guess about the same time to downtown. That said, the parking is free and that along with the free breakfast make it quite attractive. BTW: No bedbugs were seen or felt. I believe posters should be careful using the bedbug card as it unfairly taints a good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: polkadotsprinkles
Reviews.Content: Woke up with bed bug bites on my face the next day! The hotel is very much aware that the place is infested but will not admit it. We were offered a room without bed bugs (how is this possible when I`m sure the whole place is infested?) but we declined and left. The man at the desk was very rude about it too and accused us of lying. How could I be lying when there are bites all over my face? Terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay ANYWHERE else but here”
Reviews.Author: L0tusBoy
Reviews.Content: Awful hotel. Arrived late night from the airport, and were greeted by a group of prostitutes as we got out of the taxi. Sad to say, it went downhill after that. Rooms awful - uncomfortable bed, dirty, noisy... Suffice to say, we ate in the restaurant at the CN tower the next morning, and took the maitre d's recommendation and changed hotels that afternoon!! Never going to stay in a Days Inn anywhere in the world after that!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, further out of Toronto than expected”
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this hotels we were quite concerned about what we had booked, however we found the hotel was what we would expect for what we paid. Reception desk were helpful, we didn't expect to get a breakfast and found it had a fair selection and the receptionist restocked it often. The rooms were clean, quiet (no noise from next door), and plenty of tv choice. The downside for us was that the hotel was further out of toronto than we expected and what money we saved on this hotel was then spent on taxi's in and out of toronto for 2 days. Overall we would use this hotel again as an over night stop on the way further north.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: travel4dawah
Reviews.Content: Given that this location is on Kingston Road, the standards are already lowered manifolds. The reception area gives this place a worse look than it deserves. The rooms are not that bad, I've been to worse rooms. Offers a breakfast out of the reception area which I find very odd. The staff look like they hate working there! The location is not that close to downtown but a comfortable distance away. I hope I don't have to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but you need to know what your getting”
Reviews.Author: tipp86
Reviews.Content: Ok il start with the 2 problems we had on the second day our toilet was blocked and our remote stopped working. The girl moved us one room away and there was no issues. Its annoying but not the end of the world. Good points - Nice size rooms, Good tv choice, beds are ok, free news paper, its a great price we payed maybe $55 Breakfast is self served and pretty basic but perfect for the price you pay a great added extra and saves maybe $15 for a couple. Staff were fine couldnt ask for much more they helped when asked and solved issues quick. Location is key here, i booked on hotwire and did not expect to be that far away but i gambled and got it wrong. The location is fine if you have a car or your happy to use public transport. It will take you 50mins to get to the city center but its simple and just a short walk from the hotel to the bus stops. We done it with suitcases so anyone complaining id ignore. At the end of the day it comes down to budget the hotel is great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “NICE AND FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: louie_1222
Reviews.Content: Very nice bed and very cleand hotel.....( very friendly and helpful staff )

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Bed Bug”
Reviews.Author: DavidChen305
Reviews.Content: Me and my Friend got both Bed Bug Bites, Not Happy only itching

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff, nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: neostigmine
Reviews.Content: I really liked my stay at days inn at Scarborough, i met 4 different staff all very friendly and helping, breakfast was very good, there is a lake near by actually a staff told me to visit there, and me and my hubby just loved it, room was clean and quite, i had a good night sleep, it was just the lobby that smelled a bit funny rest no issues at all, it is indeed recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Midlandpark3
Reviews.Content: When we walked into the reception area, a hotel guest was there showing the staff the bites he got from the bedbugs. He'd already been in two different rooms. When I asked the receptionist about this, she said "not ALL the rooms have bedbugs." We canceled our reservation and left. We had stayed at this hotel a few years ago because it was cheap. Location is OK and the place was a bit grim but still clean. Now? yuck.

Reviews.Title: “It was DISGUSTING and the service was Repulsive!”
Reviews.Author: TBGagnon
Reviews.Content: THe reception area smelled of URINE, the front desk was most UNHELPFUL, and they double charged me and 3 weeks later have still tried to make no ammends to reimburse me! NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: Travelplanner2010
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms in this hotel at the end of June 2010 for my family's one week trip in Eastern Cannda. However, I found this is the worst hotel I stayed and I had to book another hotel for another night. First of all, the rooms are stuffy and the mattress is dirty. The worst thing happened at 3 AM, someone next door turned on the TV and spoke very loudly. I went to downstairs to ask for help. The front desk called the room, but nothing changed. So I went to front desk again and asked for changing the room. But the staff told me all room had been occupied, which was not a truth based on my observation, and he could not do anything. I felt so helpless at that time. My wife and I, with my little baby, had to move to another room I booked and stayed with my parents for the rest of night. The next morning, I tried to talk with manager about this issue. But I was told that the manager was not available because it 's Sunday. Overall, this hotel and its neighborhood are not good for your family trip. Try to book somewhere else if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking - don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: RScoxxx
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights here recently with my wife (Feb 2010) because it was so inexpensive - web special of $121... decided to give it a try despite the bad reviews I had read online. Well, here's my experience: 1. One of the two queen beds in my room had disgusting armpit smell on the comforter - very disturbing. We moved to the other bed, this fixed this problem. 2. The same offending sheet had cigarette burn holes in it... 3. My wife went to make coffee and was shocked to find there was still water in the machine and in the coffee pot from Lord-knows-when! The water in the reservoir had slimy oil-slick surface... I took the whole thing down to the front counter, they were very quick to replace it with a brand new machine, and even came up to the room and plugged it in. (This is about the only bit of service I'm happy with..) 4. The room hadn't been vacuumed since ?... we found a candy on the floor that any normal half-attempt at cleaning the floors would have picked up. 5. NONE OF THE WINDOWS OPEN - ANYWHERE. Sorry..was I yelling? NONE OF THE WINDOWS OPEN. IN ANY OF THE ROOMS. 6. You are not allowed to use the stairwells at either end of the hall - only the elevator, else an alarm sounds. I found that strange. Using the stairs would have been more convenient for me to get to my car.. 7. Tried to have a bath at one point. Great! -- no bathtub plug! Had to go downstairs for that as well, management stole one from an unoccupied room. Wonderful. Now that room doesn't have one 8. Lastly, what a pleasant surprise upon checkout to find they tried to "up" the price by an additional $20... when I complained and said I'd booked online at $121.44, they adjusted the bill down to $121, but only after a back-room consultation with other staff. Nice try guys! Oh, I guess one other thing.. why not tell guests the free-wireless password when they check in... I would think more people than not travel nowadays with laptops.. why should we have to call down to ask what the password is? Minor thing, but it still irritated me. THOROUGHLY UNRECOMMENDED. LOOK ELSEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: “dayss in”
Reviews.Author: Kani86
Reviews.Content: I have Stayed in Dayss inn downtown before, But as compared to my earlier experience ,it was not that great this time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Lakeview”
Reviews.Author: SunnyB0y
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at the Days Inn Toronto East Lakeview. The room was clean and comfortable, huge bed, with tea and coffee making facilities and complimentary water provided. Nightly turn down service also included. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with directions etc. I loved the old charm of the hotel. We had continental breakfast included in the rate which had lots of choice and a complimentary newspaper delivered to the room. This is a perfect hotel if you are looking for a location to get lakeview and birds singing in the morning. lovely feeling The only let down for us was after returning home we realised my patner had left his jumper in the room hanging up and after making several calls to the hotel they have no trace of it. Such a pity otherwise our stay would of have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Business suite was great”
Reviews.Author: jlondon7
Reviews.Content: Room 324 - view of Lake Ontario - refrigerator, microwave, coffe maker, modern, clean, 2 queen sized beds, desk, reading chair Spent 3 days here during Christmas while visiting family in the area. Helpful staff, free parking & no traffic noise at back of building.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: Brandy1294
Reviews.Content: All I can say is, what a dump. From the moment we entered the floor to our room there was an odd smell which didn't go away once we got in the room. Unfortunately we are smokers, and this is part of the reason why we decided to stay here. There were burn marks all over the desk in the room (this makes all smokers look bad, we certainly don't burn holes in our things and would never do it in a hotel either), the carpet was old and frayed, the bathroom door had obviously been smashed in at some point and the door knob was barely hanging on the door. One lamp next to the bed didn't have a knob to turn it on with, and the knob on the other lamp just kept turning and turning after we finally got it on, therefore the only way to turn it off was by unscrewing the bulb. The white ceiling was a pale beige color, definitely time for a new paint job, and/or better ventilation in the rooms where smoking is allowed. The windows cannot be opened, so we had to waft in our own smoke all night. There was a propane fireplace in the room, but after seeing the obvious uncaring attitude of the staff we decided not to chance turning it on in case the thing exploded!! To top it all off, it cost us $70 to get a taxi here from the airport. Don't waste your time and money here, if you smoke, either try to find another hotel, or buy the patch til you get back home.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jojo231
Reviews.Content: This had to be the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at. My friend and I came to Toronto for a fun girls trip and went home with odd bites all over our body from this hotel. I sent a email and made many a phone call to the hotel when I got back home and did not get a response that I was looking for. They told us that their rooms were very clean and that they were cleaned on a daily basis. This is not true. Our room was not cleaned for 2 days in a row. We had to ask someone to clean our room for us. I found that this unexcpetable. If there were another hotel at the time to stay in that weekend we would have left in a heart beat. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!! We were told that it was close to downtown which it was not. It very sketchy area of the city as well. Save your money and stay else where!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Moutarde22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights back in May while the floors were being redone at our house. This is your pretty standard Days Inn, nothing great but just ok. Location is in Scarborough, about 15 kilometres from downtown Toronto. I'd suggest you better have a car if you stay at this hotel because access to transit is limited and it will take you forever to get somewhere. Service was allright. Breakfast was included, but was basically nothing. Diluted orange juice, cheap croissants and muffins that are sold by the dozen at your local grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Worts ever lodging”
Reviews.Author: akifucmak
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone, I've never known that staying in a Days Inn (Lakeview East Toronto) would be a disaster that much... I have made my reservation through your call center and gave them my credit number. TOTAL ROOM RATE was : $ 349.96 Canadian Dollar. My wife has arrived couple hours before than me. Front desk clerk (Sami) charged on her credit card as $400.00 (that higher even after taxes) After I arrived the hotel I asked him why did he charged my wife's credit card while he is having my card number and knowing me coming in a couple hours. He said it is "Hotel Policy". I work for an international company and travel a lot in USA and Canada. I have never was pre-charged by any other Hotels in North America. I told him that was insulting. He murmured and never gave a satisfying answer. When I request cancelling the transaction he refused and mentioned that was a "Hotel Policy" as well. He said he can only cancel that transaction if we agreed to be charged on our card as corrected amount. Middle of the night I didn't have any other choice and I had to accept what he said. He charged us on our credit card. Ne never apologized for overcharged. Next day morning I have seen CAA / AAA sign on front desk wall. I requested the front desk lady to be applied CAA / AAA discount. She said that is not gonna happen, it was too late. I have never been mentioned AAA discount could be applicable in the hotel when I was making my reservation at first place. That was second failure. Third morning while I was preparing my breakfast I realized the bagels were mildewed. Again when I mentioned to service staff he looked me like that I was guilty and brought another package without apologizing. That was my ever worse lodging experience and it is pity having a beautiful location but inexperienced stuff combination. Akif

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AncientGirl
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, good bed. No problems with staff. The only thing that was a little disturbing was the elevator's noise - our room was on his side. It's far from Toronto downtown, but it was okay because we were by car. There wasn't a lake view at all. Neighborhood good. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice simple stay”
Reviews.Author: Night_Star
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 days, clean hotel and semi friendly staff. Was charged $10 extra for arriving early even though I specified we'de\ be arriving early. Some staff members were great while others were just plain rude. Free wireless room internet was helpful to allow for our work to be done, but there seemed to be a slight problem with a toothbrush. (I forgot mine and asked for one there. After 3 hour, I finally had to go back and remind them) Nice stay though. I would go back there again. Good location - about 20 minutes to downtown TO

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was large, clean and in good condition. The front desk staff were pleasant. I enjoyed the breakfast and the price for the room was very fair. If I am in this area again, I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: jmohanlall
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Days Inn Lakeview on Kingston Road in Toronto. We picked this hotel mainly because of the price, it was about half what the downtown hotels were charging. You can pick up a TTC bus about a block down the road, which takes you to Victoria Park subway station. From there you can access anywhere in downtown Toronto easily, though be prepared for about a 40 minute ride. The hotel was very well-kept, clean, and quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They suggested a local eating spot within walking distance (Bo Peep) which is a neighborhood diner with very good food and reasonable prices. We ate dinner one night, and breakfast the next day at Bo Peep. There is also a Tim Hortons and several other diners within walking distance. The only drawback to this hotel is the distance from downtown. If you want a nice quiet place to stay and can't afford the downtown prices, this a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, not great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced ($90 Canadian), but the location was 20 to 30 minutes to everything touristy. Free praking. No subway nearby. The rooms were clean, lobby was new. Staff somewhat irritable to guests and very much want to "negotiate" everything. Internet access not available unless you get upgrade business suite. Breakfast was good but doesn't change. Near to Bluffer's Park, a nice trip to Lake Ontario site (no swimming).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel a few weekends ago and I had an amazing experience. I am not sure about the last posting up here but it is pretty misleading. The staff was very helpful and the room was much nicer than I expected. I understand the last user frustration but they may have shown up late or approached the front desk in a rude manner, all I know is I had a great experience. If you are looking for a inexpensive room close to the city you should give this hotel a try!

Reviews.Title: “Days East Lakeview - Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: JRSwans
Reviews.Content: I had read bad reviews, but decided to take a chance on this place...I was not disappointed! Located 7 miles (15 minutes) from downtown Toronto; the entire hotel was immaculate, the staff was cordial and the business-class room was great for the price (70 CAD). Continental breakfast included standard fare and there was plenty of free parking and free local newspapers. There was construction next door, but it was never loud and the area is still tidy. "Lakeview" however, is misleading as there was no view that I could find. All said, a very pleasant experience with a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a "smoking" jacuzzi suite at this hotel because we wanted an affordable weekend away. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that there were no smoking rooms available, but that we could take a standard smoking room if we wanted. We showed our room confirmation printout to the front desk clerk, who proceeded to tell us that there was nothing he could do for us. We told him that we wanted to cancel our reservation because they were not willing to honour the reservation that we had made. We were abruptly told that if we chose to do that, we would be charged for the night anyway, regardless of the error that was made. We asked to speak to a manager and of course, the manager was unavailable. The clerk told us to call the Days Inn Customer Service Line, which we proceeded to do. The agent we spoke with was rude and did not even aplogize for the error. She simply told us that there was nothing she was willing to do. We decided to take the room anyway, but when we arrived there, it did not look anything like the picture on the Days Inn website. So, we went back to the front desk to speak with the clerk. Again, he told us that we could not cancel the reservation without a charge. He ended up moving us to a standard room, which although decent enough, was not what we had booked. To top it all off, we were woken up on Sunday morning by loud televisions both beside us and above us. Oh, and the name "Lakeview" is quite misleading. We were on the top floor and the view of the lake was minimal and required looking over several sketchy houses that backed onto the hotel. Overall, this was a horrible experience. If we had known that we were going to be stuck with a standard room, we would have booked a hotel downtown. We do not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “when money is tight”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: clean and good breakfast at the East/lakeview. I would not go with a nice car: broken glass is present everywhere on the parking lot. It must have been visited by burglars. Do not confuse it with the other Days Inn East. Expect to drive 20 minutes in the suburbs to get dowtown.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Toronto East Lakeview
HotelInfo.Address: 2151 Kingston Road | Birchmont Rd/Kingston Road, Toronto, Ontario M1N 1T5, Canada
